Hey there! My name is Mark, but most people know me on the internet as Goodgis.

I‚Äôm a full-time Graphic Designer who makes video games and shares my adventures on Youtube. I specialize in making cute, colorful games and am currently working on a Metroidvania called Dewdrop Dynasty.

I also run my own little game studio called Firith Studio. It's been my dream, ever since I was a kid, to hire my friends and make Firith Studio a full-time job. And it's crazy to think that every day I get a little bit closer to that goal.

I‚Äôm probably most known for games such as The Keeyp, Wizbirds Online, Blizzard Blowout 64, and of course Dewdrop Dynasty. Wishlist on Steam!

If you've ever dreamt of making video games, want to become a better game developer, 3D artist or programmer then you're in the right place. üëæ

Our mission is to help 'empower aspiring game developers to create and grow' and we've had the honour of helping more than 1 million students on their game dev journey. üå± 

Our online game development school teaches thousands of people to code by making games. Our courses show you how to make your own games, using free game engines Unity C#, Unreal C++ and Unreal Blueprints. Reach players on Apple/PC, iOS, Android, other mobile platforms and consoles. We also teach drawing, 3D modelling in Blender, game design and more.

Check out our courses at üëâ https://www.GameDev.tv 

This channel gives you access to all future content, ad-free and with special YouTube-only content such as livestreams, interviews and more. 

Thanks for stopping by üòÅ
I make disasters!

Hey! Welcome to the Game Development Center! Where I help you, express your creativity!

Many of us have had the thought of making a game at one point in our life. Most of us have amazing and creative ideas, but making a game is a long haul that takes time and discipline. Plus, for most of us, it requires a whole new skill set to develop.

On this channel I help you with that challenge, that journey, to make your own game. We focus on the Godot Game Engine, the third most popular, and quickly growing, game engine at the moment. Also, you will find some general game theory, or project management tutorials pop-up from time to time.

Have fun watching the tutorials and let me know what you think! 

Want to talk GameDev and Godot? Join the discord! https://discord.gg/DwcFXyS

For business inquiries: stefangamedev@gmail.com 
Note: if I had a dollar every time an 'AAA' brand has reached out, I could retire. There are too many scams for me to filter legitimate proposals. Be creative.

Solo indie dev trying to make games with Godot ü§ñ

I am a video game developer, mostly known for creating Fallout. I plan to use this channel to tell stories about game development, including stories about design, programming, team building, working for development companies, pitching to game publishers, and even a few stories about my short stint as a co-owner of a company, Troika Games. I have been doing this for more than forty years, so I have a lot of stories to tell.

I also eat a lot of dark chocolate.

We're a group of game industry veterans that make videos on the game development industry and how to make video games.

Working in videogames we get a lot of questions from friends, family, and people that are either curious about the industry, wanting to get started in the industry, or simply just love talking games. 

This channel is for anyone that wants to know about the insiders perspective on game development. 

Ask a Question!
We answer your #gamedev questions! If you‚Äôre curious about anything in the game development world, leave a comment or tweet us at @askgamedev 

Follow us:
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/askgamedev/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/askgamedev/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/askgamedev 
Web: http://www.askgamedev.com

Hi there! My name is Thomas Brush, and I'm a game developer. I'm a huge fan of pushing past insecurity to not only become something great, but build something great. On my channel I discuss the business of making indie games, and also chat with full time indies on the Full Time Game Dev podcast. If you're interested in learning more about game development, feel free to check out my massive game dev program, FullTimeGameDev.com! 

Check out all of my stuff here: https://linktr.ee/atmosgames

For all inquiries please email thomas@fulltimegamedev.com

GDC Festival of Gaming returns this March 9-13, 2026! For more information, be sure to visit our website and subscribe to the GDC mailing list!

Join the GDC mailing list: https://reg.gdconf.com/Subscribe/

Follow GDC on X: https://x.com/Official_GDC
Follow GDC on Bluesky: https://bsky.app/profile/officialgdc.bsky.social

GDC Festival of Gaming talks cover a range of developmental topics including game design, programming, audio, visual arts, business management, production, online games, and much more. Subscribe to the channel to stay on top of regular updates, and check out GDC Vault for thousands of more in-depth talks from our archives.

yo! i am a gamedev working on a game called Megabonk. it's a 3rd person roguelike with a bunch of upgrades, characters, randomly generated maps & more! It's inspired by games like Vampire Survivors and Risk of Rain 2, so if you like those, you will probably (maybe) like my game Megabonk! also make sure to wishlist it on Steam. or else mr. bones will be sad. you don't wanna make mr. bones sad. 

im hugely inspired by other creators on Youtube Dani (rip in piece dani my beloved), Blargis, Barji, and more!

Welcome to the official Microsoft Game Dev channel!

Our goal is to help you succeed in your game development journey. Subscribe to stay up to date on the latest tools, tips, and technology from Microsoft.

You can learn more at https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/games
Join fellow game developers in our community channel on discord at https://discord.gg/msftgamedev
Follow us on X at @MSFTGameDev or BlueSky at msftgamedev.bsky.social 

Microsoft YouTube Community Guidelines:

1). Harassment of any kind will not be tolerated.
2). Be kind! We're all here to learn and help each other make games. Remember to be supportive and helpful.

If you're looking for game development guidance, look no further! You've landed in the perfect spot. Welcome to my channel dedicated to teaching game development using Unity, where we embark on an exciting journey from concept to creation. Whether you're a beginner eager to learn or a seasoned developer seeking advanced techniques, join me as we unlock the secrets of game design, coding, and everything in between. Let's collaborate and bring your gaming visions to life, one step at a time!

Learn how to make games in Unity!

Hosted by Matt Gambell an independent Game Developer (and former evangelist for Unity Technologies). Game Dev Guide videos offer easy to digest tips, tricks and tutorials using professional experience within a wide variety of game development topics. 

With an entertaining presentation style and an engineering focused approach to problem solving, Game Dev Guide offers scalable solutions to your everyday development problems without wasting your time.

Yo!  I'm Ben.  I'm a 33 year old software developer by day, and aspiring indie game developer by night (and early morning).  

I created this channel to document my attempt at becoming a successful indie game developer while managing the responsibilities of a full-time job and maintaining a fun and healthy lifestyle.  I hope to post both technical content about the game development work I'm doing as well as lifestyle-focused content to show how I try to balance everything I do.

I hope that my content here might serve to inspire any others who share my passion for creating and sharing games!  Hope you enjoy.

- Ben

Disclaimer:
In my video descriptions I have some Amazon Affiliate links to my desk equipment.  As an Amazon Associate I earn from qualifying purchases.  Thanks for your support!

iHeartGameDev is a channel all about game development. Together we explore the ins and outs of the Unity game engine and learn best practices in programming through highly detailed tutorials that break everything down to be as beginner-friendly as possible. From character animations, to camera systems and so much more: there is so much to learn and share as we progress on our game dev journeys!
